required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Veliparib Plus Carboplatin and Paclitaxel Versus Investigator's Choice of Standard Chemotherapy in Subjects Receiving First Cytotoxic Chemotherapy for Metastatic or Advanced Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) and Who Are Current or Former Smokers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Multicenter, Phase 3 Trial Comparing Veliparib Plus Carboplatin and Paclitaxel Versus Investigator's Choice of Standard Chemotherapy in Subjects Receiving First Cytotoxic Chemotherapy for Metastatic or Advanced Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) and Who Are Current or Former Smokers

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 2-arm, Phase 3 study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of veliparib plus carboplatin and paclitaxel versus the Investigator's choice of standard chemotherapy in Lung Subtype Panel (LSP) positive subjects with metastatic or advanced non-squamous non-small cell lung cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival (OS) in the LSP (Lung Subtype Panel) positive subgroup
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from first dose of study drug.
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the number of days from the date that the participant was randomized to the date of the participant's death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) in the LSP (Lung Subtype Panel) positive subgroup and all participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from first dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate is defined as the proportion of participants with complete or partial response as determined by the investigator per Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (version 1.1).

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) in the LSP (Lung Subtype Panel) positive subgroup and all participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years from first dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival is defined as the number of days from participant randomization to the date the participant experiences an event of disease progression (PD) or death (all causes of mortality), if PD is not reached.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years from first dose of study drug.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the number of days from the date that the participant was randomized to the date of the participant's death.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life in the LSP (Lung Subtype Panel) positive subgroup and in all participants
other_outcome.time_frame: From Screening (prior to dosing) up to 2 years
other_outcome.description: Participants will answer the European Quality of Life-5 Dimensions-5 Levels Questionnaire (EQ-5D-5L) and the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT) Lung Symptom Index-17 questionnaire.

other_outcome.measure: Duration of overall response (DOR) in the LSP (Lung Subtype Panel) positive subgroup and in all participants
other_outcome.description: The duration of overall response for a participant is defined as the number of days from when the criteria is met for a complete or partial response (whichever occurs first), to the date that progressive disease (PD) is objectively documented.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status in the LSP (Lung Subtype Panel) positive subgroup and in all participants
other_outcome.time_frame: From Screening (prior to dosing) up to 2 years

arm_group.description: veliparib on Days -2 to 5 (7days) and carboplatin and paclitaxel on Day 1 of a 21 day cycle
Either carboplatin and paclitaxel, cisplatin and pemetrexed, or carboplatin and pemetrexed on Day 1 of a 21 day cycle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must be ≥ 18 years of age. Life expectancy > 12 weeks.
- Subject must have cytologically or histologically confirmed advanced or metastatic non-squamous NSCLC and are current or former smokers.
- Subject must have NSCLC that is not amenable to surgical resection or radiation with curative intent at time of screening.
- Subject must have at least 1 unidimensional measurable NSCLC lesion on a CT scan as defined by RECIST (version 1.1).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a known hypersensitivity to paclitaxel or to other drugs formulated with polyethoxylated castor oil (Cremophor).
- Subject has a known hypersensitivity to platinum compounds.
- Subject has peripheral neuropathy ≥ grade 2.
- Subject has squamous NSCLC, or an untreated known EGFR mutation of exon 19 deletion or L858R mutation in exon 21, or a known ALK gene rearrangement.
- Subject has received prior cytotoxic chemotherapy or chemoradiotherapy for NSCLC.

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
